discussion_comments.comment_body: Don't disable things that can be fixed. Here, the linting is correct.
My understanding is that `AB` is not the same as `A{'B'}`. The later is rendered as two different text nodes and then combined. Why is this test changing?
prettier got a little too helpful here. I'll revert it back.

It was actually `xo --fix` formatted it. I restored it back as well as another instances in the same file. https://github.com/vadimdemedes/ink/pull/264/commits/eaf6c6d8ae156def8a1351276022c64f295cfc29
Can you open an issue on https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react if there isn't already one?

Based on https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/blob/7dce90a4f570847b33eaefddb8d9bb7d6eca9dc5/docs/rules/jsx-curly-brace-presence.md, `xo --fix`correcting `A{'B'}`to `AB`is correct behavior. 

In our case, we're intentionally causing this scenario. To prevent fix from correcting it, we should either disable globally as I've done or locally on each line/file. What would you prefer?
The original is how `xo --fix` formats it. Is this a bug?
Definitely a bug in ESLint-plugin-react or our config for it. Most likely the former.

This is formatted by `@typescript-eslint/indent`. I get `Expected indentation of 1 tab but found 2.` when I use your suggested format. I'm going to clone `typescript-eslint`package to see if I can replicate this in their tests.
I believe this is the issue that we're experiencing https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/issues/880
